---

## GAD-7 vs PSF

The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Psychiatric Symptom Frequency Scale (PSF) are two established tools psychologists and social scientists use to monitor a patient's mental health. Despite their significance, comparing the two can prove to be quite a challenge due to their differing nature, thus detracting from an efficient research process. Here is where 'Harmony', a tool designed specifically for questionnaire harmonisation, comes into play. Using advanced natural language processing and AI models, it allows for a detailed comparison of GAD-7 vs PSF, promoting a quicker and more accurate analysis. One of the key advantages of Harmony is the ability to categorize and match the elements of different questionnaires, offering researchers a streamlined and comprehensive overview of GAD-7 vs PSF. Furthermore, Harmony can analyse items in multiple languages, broadening its applicability. Harmony provides a measured percentage match between each item on the GAD-7 and PSF, allowing for a nuanced understanding of both instruments. Therefore, if you're seeking an efficient way to alleviate the burden of manual harmonisation when studying GAD-7 vs PSF, Harmony is your ideal solution. By using this intelligent software tool, you can expedite your research process and facilitate a more profound understanding of the relationship and areas of overlap between these two important psychological assessment scales.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
